drivers.driverDescription: Typically, opportunities in social entrepreneurship are based on the need to create social value which benefits the local community. A social enterprise usually does this by solving a problem or providing assistance in an area of need or disadvantage. Therefore, creating social value and not wealth is the main driver for social entrepreneurs. Additionally, they need to achieve financial stability to maintain value. Here is a quick glimpse at the market niches which have many social enterprises:

kpis.kpiQuestion: Number of Ongoing Projects
Number of projects in the pipeline
Number of clients
Number of Clients working with Humans in the Loop (HITL) for more than a year (recurring clients)

levers.leverDescription: How many people are employed and their diversity

drivers.driverDescription: Increasing Value ‚Äì Employee training can teach new skills or improve existing skills. This helps to provide more expertise and increase their value to be able to perform more than one job. Diverse skill sets can help your employees transfer to open positions in your organization.

kpis.kpiQuestion: Highest level of education completed by employees (% split or average)
Share of workers currently attending classes (%)
Share of workers planning to enrol in further education in the coming years (%)
Share of workers having previous professional experience
Average professional experience in years
Share of workers having part-time/freelance jobs in addition to HITL (%)
Average number of hours of training received /employee / month
Average number of training opportunities available / employee / year
Share of trainings provided that deliver official certificates
Efficiency improvements for pre-defined tasks (average in minute)
Average recommendation rate of trainings by employees / or satisfaction score

drivers.driverDescription: Another benefit of becoming a social entrepreneur is the freedom to explore and create innovative solutions that can inspire change. Social entrepreneurs are constantly on the lookout for new and inventive solutions to problems and often enlist leaders within their field to assist in project development. Taking risks rewards social entrepreneurs; thinking outside the box and looking for create ways to address problems.

kpis.kpiQuestion: Average time since last update of tools used
Hours worked from home/Total number of hours worked
Enabling new ways of working

drivers.driverDescription: Social entrepreneurs create businesses in a variety of industries that can have a positive impact on society, including alternative energy, health awareness and education. Social entrepreneurs view communities as the solution and not as the beneficiaries of products and services. Social entrepreneurs provide the resources and expertise that help communities improve their qualities of life.

% women in the workforce (measured for each country)

Number of  long term partners (longer than 2 years)

Job satisfaction rating  - % employers rated as middle tier (satisfaction ratings 6-8)
Job satisfaction rating  - % employers rated as bottom tier (satisfaction ratings 0-5)

drivers.driverDescription: This social entrepreneurship delivers benefits in a self-sustaining way by using their revenues to finance activities that generate social benefit. Social entrepreneurs use their business and creative skills to help identify and solve social problems on a large scale. Sustainability projects our ability to generate social benefit
